description.narrative: 106/005 Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide continued access to Child Protection services and critical supplies for women and children for strengthening Infection Prevention and Control and for suppressing the COVID-19 transmission at community level

sector.narrative: Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)
Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development
Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
Alternative care reform and service provision
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building (including police)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services

2019 Bangladesh: Evaluation of Gender in the UNICEF Bangladesh Country Programme 2017-2020

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 106/005 Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide continued access to Child Protection services and critical supplies for women and children for strengthening Infection Prevention and Control and for suppressing the COVID-19 transmission at community level
Number of children, parents and primary caregivers provided with community based mental health and psychosocial support and messaging [COVIDSitRep]
Number of children without parental or family care provided with appropriate alternative care arrangements [COVIDSitRep]
Number of children and adults that have access to a safe and accessible channel to report sexual exploitation and abuse [COVIDSitRep]
Number of UNICEF personnel and partners that have completed training on GBV risk mitigation and referrals for survivors [COVIDSitRep]
